so in today's lesson we are going to

continuous tense okay so first thing
let's understand when we talk about the

action that is not on so you anticipate
you assume the things are going to

we use the future perfect tense now in
my first example I have been teaching
English for two years in May 2015
so first let's understand when do we use
the future perfect continuous tense we
use it for longer actions that are going
to be extended or that extend to a
specific time in the future now today we
are not in May yet
okay so May is the future so that's the
specific time in the future okay so I'm

still
teaching and this action is going to be

the action that has been going on for a
long period and that is going to

perfect continuous tense
the structure is will have been with the

form to show that in the future so I
have the future I will this action is

it's an auxilary we'll bring it before
